intro: Lysiphyllum dewitii, commonly known as the New Zealand sea holly, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to salt spray and sandy soils. Lysiphyllum dewitii has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators. It is often found in coastal dunes and is considered a rare and endemic species.
